title: Soup bowl
text: Chinese factories developed a vocabulary of patterns that could be applied to each piece of a dinner service.  The <I>FitzHugh<I> pattern made from 1780-1820s consists of four botanical clusters evenly spaced around a central panel.  The center could feature a landscape, monogram, or coat of arms--note the differences between this <I>FitzHugh<I> soup bowl and the hot water plate below, and the two <I>FitzHugh<I> tureen stands on the opposite wall, one green, one orange.
